If you get attacked this way, the same creature can't also AoO you for leaving their threatened square in the same turn.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/More Rules/Size and Reach.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Stacking Damage and Defense
item.description:
When you stack a source of flat damage reduction and multiplicative reduction, add them together in the way that reduces the damage the most.
When you have multiple sources of increasing damage by a percentage, add the percentages together, do not multiply.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/More Rules/Stacking Damage and Defense.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: At-Will
item.description: An At-Will ability can be used as many times as desired, as long as you spend the appropriate actions (if any).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Recharging Abilities/At-Will.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Limited
item.description:
A Limited ability can only be used once, after which you must Long Rest to restore it.
If it is a Mana ability, such as a Technique or Spell, you can prepare a different slot with the ability to use it again.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Recharging Abilities/Limited.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Mana
item.description:
Mana Slots (Mana): All creatures have 2+LV Mana unless otherwise stated.
When selecting Techniques or Spells, each one takes up one Mana Slot, unless otherwise stated.
How you use a given slot is determined by whether the ability is At-Will, Recharge, or Limited.

At-Will abilities can be used as you like, without affecting the Mana Slot.
Recharge abilities will temporarily consume the slot until you use the Recharge Abilities action. You do not need to re-prepare the ability, it returns to the slot as if it was not spent once you use the recharge action.
Limited abilities will make you lose the slot until you Long Rest. You can re-prepare the ability to assign it to a different slot and continue to use it.
When you learn abilities that must be assigned to a slot, you must Rest to assign them to those slots. A given ability can only be assigned once in your loadout. You can rest again to reassign your abilities.
Abilities gained through class features or items usually do not take up Mana Slots, and thus you cannot re-prepare your ability to a different slot if it's Limited.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Recharging Abilities/Mana.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Recharge
item.description: A Recharge ability can only be used once, after which you can use the Recharge Abilities action to restore it.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Recharging Abilities/Recharge.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fortitude
item.description:
Fortitude Saves are one of the three primary Saves Rolled to avoid a negative effect.
Your Fortitude represents your resistance to physical hardship, such as Poison, Disease, and concussive attacks.
You add STR and LV to your Fortitude, as well as any bonuses from your Class.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Saving Throws/Fortitude.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Reflex
item.description:
Reflex Saves are one of the three primary Saves Rolled to avoid a negative effect.
Your Reflex represents your reactions and ability to evade or mitigate sudden attacks such as Area Effects and Traps.
You add DEX and LV to your Reflex, as well as any bonuses from your Class.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Saving Throws/Reflex.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Saving Throw
item.description:
Saving Throws (Saves) are Rolls decide the effectiveness of abilities or effects that do not require an Attack. It is typically the affected creature that rolls the save. In order to consider a saving throw a pass, the affected creature must roll higher than the DC of the effect.
The DC of a Saving Throw is usually 10 plus the Level of the effect, or the attacking creature's Potency.
Saves come in 3 forms: Fortitude saves (based on STR), Reflex saves (based on DEX), and Will saves (based on WIS).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Saving Throws/Saving Throw.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Will
item.description:
Will Saves are one of the three primary Saves Rolled to avoid a negative effect.
Your Will represents your mental resilience and ability to resist mental attacks such as Illusions, mind control, and Fear.
You add WIS and LV to your Will, as well as any bonuses from your Class.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Saving Throws/Will.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Ablaze
item.description: When a creature is set Ablaze, it takes 2d8 (9) Fire Damage at the start of each turn and suffers -2 AC. Before taking damage on the second turn, and every subsequent turn, it gets a Reflex save to end the effect. A creature can choose to inflict Knockdown on itself at the start of its turn for a +4 bonus to this save.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Ablaze.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Affliction
item.description: A type of permanent negative effect that can usually only be removed by taking some time off to rest, recuperate and relax. Afflictions come in tiers from 1-3. Higher tier afflictions usually require more extreme forms of care to remove. They are similar to Curses.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Affliction.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Anchored
item.description: Creature cannot use Teleportation effects. If it attempts to, the action (and ability) is wasted.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Anchored.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Asleep
item.description:
Asleep: This creature is Knocked Down, can take no actions, and cannot be awakened unless it takes damage or an ally uses the Aid action to awaken them. The creature is also Surprised and suffers -20 Perception.
If the creature is asleep through natural means, it can use perception to wake up by noticing something amiss.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Asleep.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Bleeding
item.description: Bleeding creatures take a specified amount of Damage at the start of each of their turns for a specified duration. If no duration is specified, it lasts indefinitely. The DC to stop the bleeding (with the Medicine skill, or magic healing with a CL check) is the attacker's Potency.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Bleeding.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Blinded
item.description: Sighted creature takes a -10 penalty to Perception and treats all creatures as though they had Total Concealment. Creatures' vision range decreases to 10 ft. Creature is also Surprised.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Blinded.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Blurred Vision
item.description: Sighted creature takes a -4 penalty to Perception and treats all creatures as though they had Partial Concealment.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Blurred Vision.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Charmed
item.description:
Creature cannot attack the entity that inflicted this condition. The entity that inflicted this condition has a +4 bonus on Charisma Skills against this creature.
This ends if the creature that inflicted the condition harms the charmed creature.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Charmed.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Chilled
item.description: Creature is covered in ice. Creature has -2 AC, Resistance to Fire Damage and -15 Speed. This status ends when they take physical or fire damage.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Chilled.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Clumsy
item.description: Creature takes a stacking penalty to Reflex and AC equal to the Clumsy value. This otherwise functions like Shaken. A Clumsy creature cannot ascend using Flight, or things that function similarly to flight, such as a Hover Speed.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Clumsy.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Confused
item.description: Creature considers all others enemies. Every turn, they roll d10+LUK to determine how they act. For confusion effects that last more than 1 round, each subsequent d10 roll gets 2 added to the result.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Confused.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Cursed
item.description: A Cursed creature is suffering from a permanent debilitating condition. Curses cannot be dispelled, but they all have some way to get rid of them. This usually requires some convoluted action most people wouldn't do unless prompted. Can be identified using the "identify curse or affliction" feature in the Medicine skill.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Cursed.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dazed
item.description: A more severe version of Staggered. Creature cannot take a Standard Action and cannot make AoOs. -15 Speed.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Dazed.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Defeated
item.description: Creature cannot do anything more than a mild whisper while at or below 0 HP. If they are healed to positive hit points, they do not lose the Defeated condition, but they may crawl at a rate of 10 feet per turn, or move at full speed when another creature uses Aid. See Defeat.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Defeated.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dominated
item.description: A creature that is dominated is hit with a powerful charm effect, possessed, or controlled by some other means. They are unable to control their own actions and are subject to the will of another creature.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Dominated.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Drained
item.description: A stacking condition that decreases all Rolls by 1. Lowers your current and maximum HP by 5 each stack. One stack is removed when Resting for a week straight.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Drained.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Entombed
item.description: The creature is encased in ice, stone etc. They have Total Cover and are Untargetable. Entombed creatures can only perform mental actions or try to escape (usually requiring an athletics check).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Entombed.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fascinated
item.description: Creature cannot take actions other than watch the source of its fascination. Creature loses this condition after it is attacked, has a Saving Throw inflicted on it, or succeeds on a Perception check to notice a creature in its pockets or otherwise taking an offensive action. If the source of its fascination is no longer visible (or able to be sensed for other types of fascination), the condition also ends. After this happens, the creature temporarily becomes immune to fascination for 1 minute.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Fascinated.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fatigued
item.description:
Cannot Charge or Dash. Jump is halved. -10 Athletics and Acrobatics.
Removed on a Short Rest.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Fatigued.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Frightened
item.description: Creature cannot move closer to the source of its fear. It has -6 ACC and opposed skill checks against the source of its fear.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Frightened.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Grounded
item.description: Through bent wings, malfunctioning magic, or disorientation, the creature is unable to stay airborne. Creatures currently flying immediately plummet and provoke AoOs, but retain enough flight to avoid Fall Damage. This also affects Hover speeds.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Grounded.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Held Down
item.description: Creature cannot stand from Prone.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Held Down.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Invincible
item.description: Creature's HP cannot be reduced.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Invincible.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Knocked Down
item.description: Creature is temporarily Prone until the start of the inflicting creature or effect's next turn, at which point the condition ends without Provoking or spending Movement, unless the creature is Held Down.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Knocked Down.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Mindless
item.description:
Creature does not have any capacity for reasoning. It performs basic motions regardless of external stimuli.
This status grants immunity to many Mind-Affecting effects.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Mindless.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Necrosed
item.description: Healing effects that restore HP or grant Temp HP are half as effective (minimum 1 healing).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Necrosed.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Pacified
item.description: The creature cannot take aggressive actions against enemies with intent to inflict damage or assist its allies in inflicting damage.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Pacified.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Prone
item.description: Creature is lying down or otherwise on the ground, has -4 AC and ACC, and can't move unless they spend 30 movement to end the condition, which Provokes.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Prone.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Shaken
item.description:
Creature takes a penalty to Will and Potency equal to the Shaken value. Adding new stacks of Shaken gives all stacks the longest duration of all the effects.
Usually, Shaken wears off after 1 minute out of combat.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Shaken.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Sickened
item.description:
Creature takes a penalty to Fortitude and ACC equal to the Sickened value. Otherwise functions like Shaken.
Sickened usually wears off after 1 minute out of combat.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Sickened.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Silenced
item.description:
Creature cannot speak, including to cast Spells.
Spells that state an absence of speech can still be cast.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Silenced.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Siphoned
item.description: The creature is severed from its magic. It is not capable of casting Spells or using its activated SU abilities. Constant effects, effects from items, or effects that were already cast remain in effect.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Siphoned.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Staggered
item.description: Creature can only take a Standard Action or Swift Action each turn, not both. -15 Speed.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Staggered.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Stasis
item.description: Creature is frozen in time, or some other particularly powerful effect. They are Untargetable, Unassailable, Unstoppable and Invincible. They cannot take any actions unless otherwise stated.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Stasis.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Status
item.description:
A Status Effect is a condition that is placed on a creature to apply CC, change their rolls, and otherwise modify how they interact with the world... For better or for worse.
See:
Ablaze
Affliction
Anchored
Asleep
Bleeding
Blinded
Blurred Vision
Charmed
Chilled
Clumsy
Confused
Cursed
Dazed
Defeated
Dominated
Drained
Entangled
Entombed
Fascinated
Fatigued
Frightened
Grounded
Held Down
Invincible
Knocked Down
Mindless
Necrosed
Pacified
Prone
Shaken
Sickened
Silenced
Siphoned
Staggered
Stasis
Stunned
Submerged
Surprised
Taunted
Time Out
Unassailable
Unstoppable
Untargetable
Wet
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Status.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Stunned
item.description: A more extreme form of being Dazed. Creature cannot take any actions or movement. Creature is Surprised.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Stunned.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Submerged
item.description: Target is completely surrounded in liquid. This triggers Aquatic Combat and Improved Cover.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Submerged.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Surprised
item.description:
Creature is unable to respond effectively to attacks due to Stealth, Feinting, or some other status or Circumstance. Attacks made against a Surprised creature get a +10 bonus.
This status effect is also a Circumstance that can be determined on a per-creature or per-attack basis, but can also be a condition that applies to all incoming attacks.
Creatures Surprised by the start of a combat also place below non-Surprised creatures regardless of Initiative result.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Surprised.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Taunted
item.description:
A Taunted creature must use all their attacks on the target of the taunt, and must include the target in all of their special attacks (Spells, SU, etc.). A taunted creature can only move if the movement puts them closer to the creature that taunted it.
A creature taunted by 2 or more creatures may decide which they'd like to attack (assuming they attack at all).
More extreme forms of taunt may restrict the types of actions the creature can take while taunted.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Taunted.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Time Out
item.description:
A creature in Time Out has lost the will to fight, and has surrendered to you. They cannot inflict harmful effects on anybody or anything. They also cannot cast spells without your permission. They meekly follow your commands (ex. follow me), but won’t do anything against their ethos (kick that puppy) or that is dangerous (jump off that cliff) without extreme circumstances. If you or your allies attack the creature or cast a harmful spell on it, the condition ends.
Treat it like a slightly more convenient form of unconsciousness if you want to interact with the creature after the combat. Many minion type creatures will acquire this status effect when their leader is defeated.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Time Out.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Unassailable
item.description: Creature ignores penalties that result from Circumstance or Status.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Unassailable.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Unstoppable
item.description: Creature cannot be moved by force, and can move and take actions normally regardless of any status.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Unstoppable.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Untargetable
item.description: Creature cannot be targeted.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Untargetable.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Wet
item.description:
Gain weakness to Electric and Cold Damage. When a wet creature takes Electric or Cold damage, the condition ends.
Being wet is something that can come up often in the environment. Only by being drenched in heavy rain, submerged in water or something similar can one be considered wet to the point where this has a mechanical effect.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Wet.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Abnegation
item.description: These spells focus on disabling magic and protection.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/School Tags/Abnegation.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Conjuration
item.description: These spells focus on summoning, displacement, and temporary creation.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/School Tags/Conjuration.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Divination
item.description: These spells focus on gaining knowledge through spying and querying the universe.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/School Tags/Divination.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Evocation
item.description: These spells focus on the manipulating elements and focusing power to destructive effect.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/School Tags/Evocation.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Illusion
item.description:
These spells focus on warping perception to impose one's will over others.
Enchantment spells are Illusion spells that are also Mind-Affecting.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/School Tags/Illusion.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Transmutation
item.description: These spells focus on changing things into other things.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/School Tags/Transmutation.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Air
item.description:
Effect manipulates air to produce its effect.
This is a non-Damage elemental tag.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Air.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Bond
item.description: An effect with the Buff or Bond tag grants a boon to a creature, or a shared effect. If an unwilling creature has a buff or bond used on it, it can choose to deny it.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Bond.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Buff
item.description: An effect with the Buff or Bond tag grants a boon to a creature, or a shared effect. If an unwilling creature has a buff or bond used on it, it can choose to deny it.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Buff.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Caloric
item.description: Effect either creates Food, or has special interactions when using it.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Caloric.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Charm
item.description: Charm effects allow the creature inflicting it to exert some degree of control over others. All charm effects are also Mind-Affecting.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Charm.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Companion
item.description:
In media it's very common for creatures to have minions, squires and sidekicks. This is what the companion system is for. Like most other content, the companion system is ill-suited for large quantities of creatures, like armies. It's meant to be more compact. Something to take with you on the go for your adventure. This could also reasonably extend to temporary allies that join your party.
Companions are generally tied to your class, abilities and items. Any such ability is marked with this tag.
If an ability has the companion tag, it summons an ally, or otherwise serves some kind of interpersonal function.
You can only have 2 companions, or 1 if you have -1 CHA.
Companions always act on your turn if you are present. There is no separation between your turns, you all act in the same Initiative (rolled by you).
Companions gain bonuses or penalties based off of your CHA.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Companion.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Concentration
item.description:
An effect with the Concentration tag requires some degree of upkeep from the caster and typically has a duration. Concentration effects end if the caster is Defeated, Stunned, put Asleep, or otherwise completely prevented from taking any actions. You can also cease concentration Instantly.
If you cast a spell with concentration, you must hold the staff in order to maintain your concentration. Being disarmed of a staff you are using to concentrate ends the effect. While you are concentrating on a spell, you cannot use that staff to cast other spells. However, you can use another staff to cast spells, or concentrate on another.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Concentration.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Contingent
item.description:
The effect can be cast ahead of time with a specific trigger for when it activates. A creature can only have a single contingent effect active on them at once.
The effect manifests as a clearly visible wisp of energy that floats around the creature. The DC to identify the effect increases by 5, but the fact that there is a contingent effect is clear.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Contingent.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Curse
item.description: Curse effects inflict permanent debilitating conditions on creatures. Curses cannot be dispelled, but they all have some way to get rid of them. This usually requires some convoluted action most people wouldn't do unless prompted. Can be identified using the "identify curse or affliction" feature in the Medicine skill.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Curse.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: D
item.description:
Dismissible (D) effects can be ended prematurely by the caster as a Standard Action.
Note that voluntary effects (such as buffs) can be dismissed Instantly without this tag.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/D.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Damage
item.description:
Damage is a value that subtracts from a target's HP when the effect takes place.
"Losing HP" is synonymous with taking Damage.
Damage is always assigned a type. The physical damage types are Crush, Slash, and Pierce, and the elemental types are Magic, Lightning, Fire, Cold, Holy, Poison, and Psychic. These are also Tags.
For Weapons, this value is determined by the weapon used and adds your STR. A Technique may add to this as well.
For Spells, this value is determined by your LV and Spell Power.
Any given effect will describe how to determine the damage it deals.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Damage.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Darkness
item.description: Effect either creates darkness, or has special interactions when in it.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Darkness.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Earth
item.description:
Spell manipulates earth to produce its effect.
This is a non-Damage elemental tag.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Earth.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Elusive
item.description: Elusive: This action doesn't provoke an AoO.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Elusive.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Fear
item.description: Usually inflicts Shaken or Frightened. All fear effects are also Mind-Affecting.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Fear.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Figment
item.description:
Figments create creatures, objects, and terrain that don’t truly exist. As long as the creature does not directly interact with a figment, it believes it to be real. If a creature figures out that it's fake and tells its allies, or demonstrates by moving through it, they no longer believe it to be real. Directly interacting requires doing things like walking into a wall or attacking a creature, upon which the creature rolls a Will save. A failure indicates the creature will try to run around an obstacle or that they missed a creature.
If used to satisfy the conditions of a surrender (such as making a spooky monster), the creatures affected get a will save to negate it. They have +6 on this save if they saw you cast the spell.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Figment.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Glamer
item.description: A Glamer changes a subject’s sensory qualities, making it look, feel, taste, smell, or sound like something else, or nothing at all.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Glamer.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Language
item.description: Language effects require the target to understand your spoken words, or requires some form of clear communication that mimics language (like Telepathy).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Language.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Light
item.description: Effect either creates light, or has special interactions when in it.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Light.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Martial
item.description:
Martial effects allow the user to deliver the effect using the ACC and Damage and On-Hit Effects of a wielded Weapon, even if it mentions using another form of attack.
Martial techniques and Special Attacks by default ALWAYS have the martial tag. It is not listed to save time/space.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Martial.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Mind-Affecting
item.description: Mind-Affecting effects are a more general group that include things like Fear effects, Charms, and more. Creatures that are Mindless cannot be affected by mind-affecting effects.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Mind-Affecting.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Multi-Strike
item.description: This effect, when used with an Action-Attack, is improved by attacking multiple times. It may apply its effect to every attack on your turn.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Multi-Strike.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Pattern
item.description: Like a Figment, a Pattern creates an image that others can see, but a pattern also affects the minds of those who see it or are caught in it. Common effects include Fascination or Blurred Vision. Pattern effects are also Mind-Affecting.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Pattern.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Persistent
item.description: Persistent Effects have an initial effect and an effect that persists over time. This type of effect cannot deal its persistent effect on the same round as its initial effect. Persistent effects end preemptively if the user is Defeated.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Persistent.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Polymorph
item.description:
Polymorph effects transform creatures into other creatures. Many of the features granted from polymorph effects are based off the Shapeshifter's class features. You retain the ability to speak while polymorphed. When transforming using a polymorph effect, it can fall under one of the following to determine the nature of your transformation (some can be multiple).
Chimeric Polymorph - Your form stays roughly the same, but acquires some features of the new creature that you're transforming into, such as claws, fur, a long tongue etc. When you chimeric polymorph, you do not lose access to any of your gear.
True Polymorph - Your form completely changes to the form mentioned in the ability. You completely lose access to all of your equipment. There are only a handful of features recognizable from your previous self, such as eye color.
Baleful Polymorph - This form of polymorph is inflicted upon you rather than willingly used. It functions very similarly to true polymorph, but provides fewer tangible benefits and often include debilitating Status. You lose access to your equipment and cannot speak.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Polymorph.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Scrying
item.description:
Scrying effects create a specific type of magic sensor, often from remote locations, usually for the purpose of spying on people. The sensor allows you to see and hear anything with any of your senses, so long as it is in the specified range the effect mentions.
Scrying sensors are clearly visible to the naked eye. They usually take the form of an eye. Sensors that can move can use the caster's stealth bonus to hide as they move.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Scrying.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Sigil
item.description: The effect puts magical text on a surface with some kind of delayed effect, usually triggering when a creature walks within a certain radius of the sigil. A sigil must be clearly visible in order to function. If it is obscured, then it is deactivated until it is unobscured. Most sigils have the ability to apply a passphrase that, when spoken aloud, allows a user to move through the area without triggering the sigil.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Sigil.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Subtle
item.description: The effect has a chance for nobody to notice it. If the target creature fails its save, then the effect goes unnoticed. The DC to identify a spell with the subtle tag increases by 5.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Subtle.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Tags
item.description:
Tags are descriptors that let you apply general rules to similar effects. Tags are not just limited to spells, but spells do commonly use tags. Certain tags may only effect specific parts of an ability. Use discretion when needed.
See:
School tags
Abnegation
Conjuration
Divination
Evocation
Illusion
Transmutation
Regular tags
Air
Bond
Buff
Caloric
Charm
Companion
Concentration
Contingent
Curse
D
Damage
Darkness
Earth
Elusive
Fear
Figment
Glamer
Language
Light
Martial
Mind-Affecting
Multi-Strike
Pattern
Persistent
Polymorph
Scrying
Sigil
Subtle

Water
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Tags.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Teleportation
item.description: Teleportation effects allow the user, and sometimes their allies, to instantly travel between two locations. Teleportation tends to be very limited in scope, bringing you to very specific predetermined places or being wildly off-course if not. If unspecified, you must have line of sight to the location you are teleporting to.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Teleportation.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Water
item.description:
Effect manipulates water to produce its effect.
This is a non-Damage elemental tag.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Water.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Rolling Dice and Statistics
item.description:
This game relies on a special roll, detailed below. It will be referred to as dX in the content.
Action resolution is done by using random chance to represent a range of success in an attempt to reach a target number, combined with a bonus based on your character's build, such as from their ability scores, skills, class features, active buffs, and feats.
Content is currently being made with a roll equivalent to counting successes on a d15 die, exploding on any number above 1, success being any roll (including the first). This can be written into rolling simulator websites such as Roll20 to speed things up.
The benefit of this method is that anyone can roll any number, unlike other systems where a large enough target number will make the roll impossible.
The Short Version: Every point added for or against these rolls is about a 7% difference in power. This means Attack Rolls, Skill checks, Saving Throws, DCs, Avoid, all of it. A 6 point difference is roughly a 50% boost in odds. A 10 point difference is about double. As an example, if you gain 10 Accuracy or 10 Stealth, your odds of success are about twice as high. This is the case regardless of the opponent's statistics.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Rolling Dice and Statistics.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Acrobatics
item.description:
DEX-based Skill.
Used for Balance, Tumble, and Wall Kick.
item.guid: Skills/Acrobatics/Acrobatics.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Balance
item.description: Acrobatics can be used to cross slippery surfaces, such as ice or oil slicks, at full speed. Failing the check gives you the Knocked Down condition. It can also be used to traverse or stand on incredibly small and unstable spaces, such as a cliff side or a fallen tree branch.
item.guid: Skills/Acrobatics/Balance.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Tumble
item.description: If Trained in Acrobatics, you can avoid AoOs from moving through Threatened spaces. Acrobatics is rolled against all threatening creatures’ Reflex saves. The DC of their reflex save is equal to your Acrobatics Roll. If they succeed, your movement Provokes as normal.
item.guid: Skills/Acrobatics/Tumble.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Wall Kick
item.description: If Trained in Acrobatics, As long as there are 2 walls within 5 feet of each other, or a similar arrangement with some horizontal layout, you can continually hop between them to ascend or travel. Only the vertical OR horizontal distance you cover counts against your Movement, not both. This still takes a Jump action.
item.guid: Skills/Acrobatics/Wall Kick.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Aquatic Combat
item.description: Fighting underwater gives a -4 Circumstance penalty to AC, Reflex, and ACC. Being Trained in Athletics or possessing a Swim Speed removes the penalty.
item.guid: Skills/Athletics/Aquatic Combat.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Athletics
item.description:
STR-based Skill, or DEX when appropriate.
Used for Climb, Swim, Brute Force, Catch Fall, and Aquatic Combat.
item.guid: Skills/Athletics/Athletics.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Brute Force
item.description:
Using Athletics, you can use Brute Force when there are no lockpicks or beasts of burden to handle your problems. The DC to break apart an object is modified by its quality, materials, and size. Substantial failure may cause back problems.
You can also use Athletics to represent bursts of strength that allow you to surpass your normal Carry Weight to shift large objects.
item.guid: Skills/Athletics/Brute Force.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Catch Fall
item.description: When Proficient in Athletics, as an Immediate Action, you can attempt to grab onto something to stop your fall, or to prevent an ally within reach from falling. The DC to do this is 20+the height fallen before the catch. You do not take Fall Damage when successful.
item.guid: Skills/Athletics/Catch Fall.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Climb
item.description:
Using Athletics, you can climb surfaces. Spaces you climb through are considered difficult terrain. With Athletics Proficiency, you climb at full Speed.
If you have a Climb Speed, you get a +8 bonus and use that speed instead.
item.guid: Skills/Athletics/Climb.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Swim
item.description:
Using Athletics, you can swim through liquids. Spaces you swim through are considered difficult terrain. With Athletics Proficiency, you swim at full Speed.
If you have a Swim Speed, you get a +8 bonus and use that speed instead.
item.guid: Skills/Athletics/Swim.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Create a Distraction
item.description: Using Deception as a Standard Action, you can shout something at your enemies to briefly get them to look the other way so you can give them the slip. All creatures get a roll to try and beat yours. If you succeed, you are able to roll Stealth, and they won't know where you went. This does not prevent people from finding you again using Perception.
item.guid: Skills/Deception/Create a Distraction.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Deception
item.description:
CHA-based Skill, normally rolled against Insight.
Used to Lie, Disguise, Feint, Create a Distraction, Subtle Message, and Sucker Punch.
item.guid: Skills/Deception/Deception.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Disguise
item.description:
Using Trained Deception, spend 10 minutes perfecting your makeup, outfit, and wig to appear as a person or playable race you're not. Disguise checks are usually unnecessary unless you fall under scrutiny, the person knows you/what you're pretending to be, or you're trying to enter an exclusive club, in which case they get a Perception check. Creatures get bonuses to their Perception if they know you or what you're disguised as particularly well.
You take a -2 penalty to Disguise when you try to change your race and when you change your apparent gender. When you initiate a Disguise, you tell your DM your bonus, they apply any appropriate Circumstance modifiers and roll it in secret.
Crafting a disguise without a disguise kit or magic imposes a -5 penalty.
item.guid: Skills/Deception/Disguise.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Lie
item.description:
Use Deception against a target's Insight to speak falsehoods, or to soften the truth. See Detect Dishonesty. It may be more entertaining if the DM rolls this in secret to preserve tension.
Common modifiers to increase the DC include:

The target has firsthand experience with the events
Claims that are fantastical or impossible, such as equating angels with demons or asserting a green sky
The target is knowledgeable of the subject matter
Common modifiers to make the task less difficult can include:

The target is inattentive, such as from being tired or drunk
The target trusts you
item.guid: Skills/Deception/Lie.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Subtle Message
item.description: By speaking in roundabout terms and making subtle gestures, you can use Trained Deception to communicate a simple idea (such as "we need to leave", or "time to strike") while not talking about it directly, to avoid alerting others of your intentions. The DC to convey this message is 20. The intended recipient automatically understands the message. Anyone that may be suspicious gets an Insight check to beat your Deception.
item.guid: Skills/Deception/Subtle Message.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Sucker Punch
item.description:
If you are in some kind of standoff where you aren't quite fighting your enemy yet, you can use Trained Deception or Trained Hands as a replacement for Stealth to Surprise your enemy with a melee Attack. The enemy must be aware of you in order to Sucker Punch, otherwise it is Stealth, and you must already be adjacent to use Hands for it. If you don't use an Unarmed Strike, then you have disadvantage on this check, unless you use Hands.
Certain situations where you are not able to get close to your aggressors, such as having bows pointed at you from a garrison above you, make Sucker Punching impossible.
item.guid: Skills/Deception/Sucker Punch.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Detect Compulsion
item.description: Use Trained Insight to determine when a creature is under duress from a spell or some other kind of effect that has a lasting impact on their mind, such as when Dominated or Possessed. You must actively search for this by speaking with the creature for 1 minute. Roll Insight vs the DC of the effect. If the effect has no DC, assume a basic DC based on the Potency of the source.
item.guid: Skills/Insight/Detect Compulsion.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Detect Dishonesty
item.description:
Whenever a creature makes a statement, you can roll Insight (opposed by Deception) to see if what they say aligns with what they think. If you roll lower, or if they aren't being dishonest, you don't detect dishonesty. If you succeed, you determine that something is fishy - or if a statement lacks nuance (such as a yes or no response), you can determine the correct answer. Prying further about the deception may cause the creature to reveal the truth or become hostile depending on context.
This can be combined with Deception against their Insight to hide whether or not they know you know they're being dishonest. When this is done, it may be more entertaining to have the DM roll in secret, and distribute results in secret, in order to preserve tension.
You can only roll Insight on a particular assertion or topic once.
item.guid: Skills/Insight/Detect Dishonesty.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Insight
item.description:
WIS-based Skill, but CHA can be used if it's a social cue.
Used for Detect Dishonesty, Detect Compulsion, and Intuition.
item.guid: Skills/Insight/Insight.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Intuition
item.description:
By using Trained Insight, you can observe a structure or item whose function is known, an event unfolding, or a behavior pattern to try and glean information about it. The DC is modified by how much knowledge you already possess on the topic, or how closely you're able to investigate it. A success gives you nearly prescient knowledge about the intention behind the structure, item, event, or behavioral pattern that goes beyond a basic understanding of function.
For example, when used on a Trap whose function is to shoot an arrow, your character may determine that based on its unusual angle and obvious placement, it may have been used to deter adventures from finding a secret in its line of sight instead of to actually effectively trap them. The knowledge you glean from this success will always be the reality of the situation when you follow your intuition.
item.guid: Skills/Insight/Intuition.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Coercion
item.description:
With Trained Intimidation, by having a conversation with a creature that lasts at least one minute, or by defeating a creature in combat, you can shape how they respond to you or anybody asking about you in the future. The strength of this creature's conviction is dependent on your Intimidation Roll against it.
You can make the creature keep their mouth shut about something you did to them. Any checks to gather information from this creature about you or your party change to your roll if it would be higher than the usual DC.
You can greatly exaggerate what you did to further spread fear and grand tales of your strength. Any Knowledge checks that creatures make on you when hearing about information that spreads from this creature changes to your Intimidation roll if it would be higher than the usual DC, or else they learn false information.
item.guid: Skills/Intimidation/Coercion.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Demoralize
item.description:
As an Action-Attack, inflict Shaken 1 on an enemy that can see or hear you within 30 feet. Roll Intimidation versus their Will. They are Shaken as long as you are nearby, and for 1 minute after. You can Demoralize a creature repeatedly to increase the penalty. If they pass their save, their shaken value from Demoralize decreases by 1.
If you are Trained, you can inflict Frightened instead on creatures you have Defeated before. This lasts one round, and can only be done once per day per creature. This doesn't work if they Defeated you once before as well.
item.guid: Skills/Intimidation/Demoralize.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Intimidation
item.description:
CHA-based Skill, or optionally STR when using displays of might.
Used for Coercion and Demoralize.
item.guid: Skills/Intimidation/Intimidation.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Composition
item.description: Use Alchemy on an unknown substance to learn how to create it, if it has or can be created through Alchemy. The DC is the Craft DC+5.
item.guid: Skills/Knowledge/Alchemy/Identify Composition.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Potion
item.description: Use Alchemy to identify a held Potion or Poison with a sniff or taste. The DC is the item's Craft DC.
item.guid: Skills/Knowledge/Alchemy/Identify Potion.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Magic Item
item.description:
Use [Arcana] to identify all of the magic properties of a Magic Item in reach as an Action. The DC is the item's Potency, +10 if it's cursed.
This can be attempted once per day per item.
item.guid: Skills/Knowledge/Arcana/Identify Magic Item.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Group Checks
item.description: When working cooperatively, such as to Craft an item or work a machine, use the group's highest bonus, plus 1 per helper, or 2 if they're also Proficient (max +10). When the weakest link can sink a team's effort, such as with Stealth, use the group's lowest bonus, plus the help.
item.guid: Skills/Group Checks.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Proficiency
item.description: Proficiency in a Skill marks you as "Trained" rather than "Untrained." Proficiency grants more uses for some skills.
item.guid: Skills/Proficiency.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Skill
item.description:
Skill Rolls are how players interact with the world without hitting it with their sword. Even if certain actions have a skill associated with them, you don't necessarily need to roll a skill check (no need to roll Deception if they already believe you, no need to roll Athletics in still water, etc.) When one is required, it is prompted by the DM.
If the DC to a task is more than 30 points higher than the bonus on the roll, then the DM should deem it impossible in cases where "fishing" for a success with no repercussions is the intent. The special roll allows rolling any number, so if a task is well out of a character's reach such that the DC difference is that high, it may be better to not allow the roll to preserve the narrative.
This roll can be very swingy, creating dramatically unexpected results. As such, using a skill roll as a barrier for entry can create all or nothing scenarios. There's nothing wrong with saying "the lock is too complex for you to pick," but you can't be upset when immediately after the martials of the party start smashing into the door. There should be lesser versions of success. If you barely fail the DC to scale a wall, it lowers your speed instead of falling. If you barely fail a Stealth check while trailing someone, they can tell someone is in the bushes, but not who.
Many things should not be represented by a skill or ability roll. For example, do not roll to see if someone can lift a portcullis - This is already represented by their Carrying Capacity. You should also carefully consider what a roll represents, and whether rerolls are appropriate. When rolls are made, don't be surprised when the party's expert sometimes gets outdone by the party's pet chicken. A skill check should be summarized with a "you can or you can't" when rolling may cause inconsistencies.
Skill bonuses are increased by one relevant Ability Score modifier. You add 2x the bonus to your skill check if you are Proficient.
Proficiency in a skill grants you a 2+LV bonus to the skill. Certain aspects of a skill might only be available to characters that are proficient in the skill.
Standard skill DCs are what should be used in the absence of a set or opposed DC. Remember that every 10 point difference makes the task twice as hard. They are as follows…

Some skills are opposed to other skills, while other skills will include examples comparable this chart.
item.guid: Skills/Skill.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Take 10
item.description: You can take 10 on non-opposed skill checks. This means instead of rolling, you automatically get a Natural 10. This is suitable for crafting or skipping tasks that aren't too difficult for you.
item.guid: Skills/Take 10.md

item.title: Tie
item.description: When making an opposed Skill check, ties are rerolled.
item.guid: Skills/Tie.md

item.description:
This is your new vault.
Make a note of something, or try the Importer!

item.title: Natural
item.description: A Natural result on a Roll is the result without any bonuses or penalties.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Natural.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Roll
item.description:
The default die roll for resolving things. This is used to determine the variance expected.
In Malon's Marvelous Misadventures, this is a 15-sided die, rolled until a result of a Natural 1 shows up. The amount of rolls (including the one that results in the natural 1) is totaled as the result. For example, if it took 12 rolls, then the result of this "roll" is 12.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Roll.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: CHA
item.description:
Charisma (CHA): Your leadership and personal magnetism.
Positive charisma enhances your companion creatures. Any creature that takes a companion slot gains your CHA to their Accuracy and Avoidability.
You lose a companion slot with negative CHA.
Negative CHA reduces your companion's Accuracy and Avoidability.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/CHA.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: DEX
item.description:
Dexterity (DEX): Your agility, hand-eye coordination, and general sneakiness.
You add DEX to your Reflex Save. You add your DEX to your Accuracy and Avoidability. You add DEX to Initiative.
Every point of DEX adds +5 to your speed and jump.
Negative DEX subtracts from these values.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/DEX.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: INT
item.description:
Intelligence (INT): Your knowledge, magical expertise, and logic capacity.
You add INT to Spell Power and Mana
You gain an additional skill proficiency per point of intelligence
You gain two additional languages per point of INT (listed in the skills section under linguistics)
Negative INT subtracts from Spell Power and Mana >You lose a skill proficiency per negative INT
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/INT.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Luck Check
item.description: When the chance something will happen or fail to happen is based purely on chance, you attempt a Luck Check. You just roll a d10, add (or subtract) LUK and compare the result on the die to the DC.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/Luck Check.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: LUK
item.description:
Luck (LUK): Your ability to turn tides and benefit from unlikely outcomes.
You add LUK to Avoid. You add LUK to Potency. You add LUK to Luck Checks. You add LUK to Critical Damage.
You can add LUK to a roll as an Immediate Action (that did not already add LUK).
Negative LUK subtracts from Avoid, Potency, Luck Checks, and Critical Damage.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/LUK.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: STR
item.description:
Strength (STR): Your fortitude, athleticism, and endurance.
You add STR to your Fortitude Save.
You add STR to physical attacks, such as with weapons and unarmed attacks.
When you wield a weapon in two hands, you add twice your STR to damage.
You add STR to combat maneuver checks.
Every point of STR increases your carry weight by 50%.
Negative STR subtracts from your Fortitude Saves.
Negative STR halves your Carry Weight.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/STR.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Full-Round Action
item.description: Full-Round Action: This action requires the use of your standard action and all of your free movement. You may still move if you have an ability that allows extra movement as a different action.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Full-Round Action.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Immediate Action
item.description: Immediate Action: A Swift Action that can occur off-turn. Limited to one per round, shared with Swift Action — you cannot use both in the same round.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Action System/Immediate Action.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Delay
item.description: You can wait for a later spot in Initiative. If you're already at the bottom, you can wait until a later round. When you decide to re-enter Initiative, your Initiative changes to the spot you enter.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Free Actions/Delay.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Swap Item
item.description: At the start of your turn, you can decide what's in your hands from your inventory. You can draw and put away any weapons without penalty. This is a free action as long as it's done at the start of your turn. If you decide to change what you're wielding at another point in your turn, it becomes a swift action - and you can't do both.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Free Actions/Swap Item.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Administer Potion
item.description:
Give a potion to an unconscious ally. You can use potions from either of your inventories.
A conscious ally must spend an Immediate Action to drink an administered potion.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Administer Potion.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Aid
item.description:
Provide one of the following bonuses to an ally within your reach for 1 round:

+2 to attack rolls against foes you both threaten
+2 to saving throws
+2 to AC

Alternatively, remove one stack of the following conditions: clumsy, shaken, sickened, or knockdown.
Note: Many entangle and snare effects can be removed using Athletics. Use the Aid action to assist an ally in overcoming these conditions.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Aid.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Carry
item.description: Carrying an ally allows you to move them with your movement. You must be able to lift the ally, or drag them treating all terrain as difficult terrain. You must use this action every turn you carry an ally. The creature you carry becomes clumsy 2 unless they are defeated or you aren't in combat.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Carry.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Charge
item.description: Move up to your speed in a straight line, and then make an attack.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Charge.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dash
item.description: Double your speed this round.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Dash.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Disengage
item.description: Your movement is Elusive this turn.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Disengage.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Prepare
item.description:
You can prepare swift actions, movement, free actions and standard actions to react to a specific triggering event (Ex: “a goblin opens this door, I walk up to him and shove him off the cliff”). If the triggering action never happens, you don't get your actions back.
When you prepare a standard action to attack, you can only prepare a single attack.
You cannot prepare actions outside of Initiative.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Prepare.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Hide
item.description:
Use the Stealth skill to prevent enemies from knowing your exact location in combat.
Like any other use of stealth, this must be done with cover or concealment.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Swift Actions/Hide.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Potion
item.description: Retrieve and drink a potion.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Swift Actions/Potion.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dirty Trick
item.description: Apply clumsy 2, sickened 2 or blurred vision to a creature. They must spend a standard action to get rid of the condition.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Dirty Trick.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Drag
item.description: Requires a free hand or prehensile appendage. Target creature stays adjacent to you for the remainder of your turn, up to 30 ft. If the creature is not adjacent to you when you successfully drag, they are automatically pulled adjacent to you. You can choose any space within your natural reach to place the creature in at the end of your drag.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Drag.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Grab
item.description:
Requires a free hand or prehensile appendage. As long as the Grab persists, you and your foe gain the Entangled condition. Each round you can spend another Action-Attack to maintain the Grab and make an attack against them with a melee attack, requiring no roll.
If you are moved out of reach from the target, your opponent succeeds at a Grab on you, or you are otherwise unable to maintain your grip, the target is freed and the conditions end. Opponents that Grab you in return can continue the Grab as if they had initiated it instead of you.
Special: Multiple creatures can Grab one creature. The Entangled conditions stack.
Special: Creatures ignore the attack penalty from partial and total concealment against creatures they are engaged in a Grab with.
See alternate win condition>restraint/capture for more options on locking someone down for good.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Grab.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Shove
item.description: Push the target 10ft away from you.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Shove.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Critical Damage
item.description:
Critical Damage: Damage added to a Crit.
By default, this amount is d10+LUK damage. This is in addition to your attack's normal damage.
This only applies to HP damage, and does not add to any other effect. Other abilities may change your Critical Damage.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Critical Damage.md

item.title: 🍔 Mission Statement
item.description:
Malon's Marvelous Misadventures is a TTRPG where the players take on the roles of capable adventurers in a fantasy world, facing off against the odds themselves as they plow through hordes and chow down on the rewards! It's centered on systems that maximize the ease of content creation and compatibility with what exists in other tactical TTRPGs.
The content provided will be enough to run relatively lighthearted fantasy games, and serves as a basis to create more and adapt it to your needs. The game mechanics are a blend of real-world intuition and game-y themes, setting a stage with a healthy amount of suspension of disbelief to allow more creative solutions to problems without worrying too much about adherence to realism.
item.guid: 🍔 Mission Statement.md
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia
